alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 10:25AM CDT until May 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. .Rainfall from this morning in addition to what will fall over the rest of today will likely lead to further increases in river levels, with several downstream points along the Minnesota River likely entering flood stage over the next 3 days. For now, the warnings continue upstream with the quick response from the Redwood resulting in an upgrade to a warning early. Should the forecast proceed as expected, a few other points downstream in the mainstem Minnesota River will be upgraded over the next couple days. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.1 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Saturday, the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1000 AM CDT Saturday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 13.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 03/14/2007. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
